Gladius.Name: Weapon Swap
Gladius.Effect: The user may switch to Gladius, Scutum or Pilum. (The user starts the game in Gladius).

Gladius.Name: Exercitus
Gladius.Effect: If the user is Gladius, this deals +3 damage. If Scutum, the user gains 3 DR/1. If Pilum, this move has -1 MR.

Gladius.Name: Opening Strike
Gladius.Effect: If the user is in Pilum, the target is inflicted with Confusion/1, and if the user is in Scutum, the target is inflicted with 5/1 Bleed. If not already in Gladius, the user automatically switches to it.

Gladius.Name: Forward Jab
Gladius.Effect: This move has a different effect depending on the user's weapon.Gladius = +5 damageScutum = The target's next standard/full attack loses 5 damage.Pilum = This move may be made AoE/Foes/Line 4 instead.

Gladius.Name: Shield Wall
Gladius.Effect: The user must be in Gladius or Pilum to use this move, and may be used as a non-damaging standard on the user. The user automatically switches to Scutum and only takes 75% damage from foes' attacks for one round.

Gladius.Name: Invigorate
Gladius.Effect: This move has a different effect depending on the user's weapon.Gladius: The targets' next attack deals additional damage equal to 10% of the damage dealt on the user's last attack.Scutum: Targets gain DR for one round equal to 15% of the damage that all targets collectively did on their last attacks.Pilum: The targets' gain bonus accuracy on their next attack equal to 8% (rounded down) of the damage they dealt on their last attack.

Gladius.Name: Disengage
Gladius.Effect: The user is pushed back one space. If the user is in Gladius, foes who enter the user's melee before the user's next turn take 5 damage. If the user is in Scutum, the user does not take damage from AoE attacks for one round. The user automatically switches to Pilum.

Gladius.Name: Weapon Crash
Gladius.Effect: This move has a different range and effect depending on the user's weapon.Gladius: One/Foe/Melee range, and inflicts 10 Bleed/1Scutum: AoE/Foes/Cone 2, and has 3 PushPilum: AoE/Foes/Line 3, and inflicts 6 Cripple/1If the user is under the effects of Dual Wield, the user may pick any range and effect from their two weapon effects from this move.

Gladius.Name: Dual Wield
Gladius.Effect: The user benefits from the effects of any two weapons (Gladius/Scutum/Pilum) this turn, they regain the effects of only the original weapon after the end of their turn.

Gladius.Name: Imperial Might
Gladius.Effect: If the user is in Gladius, the user gains 15% of this attack's damage as +damage for one round. If the user is in Scutum, the user gains immunity to statuses and debuffs for one round and is cured from them (before accuracy). If the user is in Pilum, the target's evasions are reduced to 0 for one round.

Gladius.Name: Iberian Steel
Gladius.Effect: This attack gains +2X dice where X is the amount of times the user has used (i. e. targeted someone with a gladius ability) their least used weapon.

Katana.Name: Fallen Blade
Katana.Effect: For every 25% (rounded down) below the user's max HP, gain 1 Enrage counter. (Each counter can only be acquired once, even if the user heals above a 25% threshold.) Katana abilities have bonus dice equal to the amount of Enrage counters the user has.

Katana.Name: Cursed Slice
Katana.Effect: If the user has 1 Enrage counter, this attack may be used when sealed. If the user has at least 2 Enrage counters, this may be used regardless of any statuses or move effects (except stun).

Katana.Name: Lunge
Katana.Effect: For every enrage counter the user has, this move gains +1 ACC. The user moves as close to the target as possible.

Katana.Name: Provoke
Katana.Effect: If the target doesn't roll at least 35 damage with an attack that targets the user on their next turn the user gains one Enrage counter.

Katana.Name: Revenge
Katana.Effect: The user gains +damage on their next standard/full attack equal to X% of the damage they took from one of the targets since the beginning of the user's last turn. X is ten times the amount of Enrage counters the user has. If the user has at least 2 Enrage counters this ability may be used as a Trigger action, but Revenge can only be used once per turn.

Katana.Name: Sharpen
Katana.Effect: If this attack kills the target, the user gains one Enrage counter and another use on this move.

Katana.Name: Costly Swing
Katana.Effect: The user takes X more damage from all attacks until the start of their next turn, where X is 10 minus twice the amount of the Enrage counters the user has (minimum 0).

Katana.Name: Bushido
Katana.Effect: If the user has at least one Enrage counter, they are cleansed from any statuses and debuffs (before accuracy). If they have two counters, the user can choose for this move to be Aoe/Foes/Burst 1. If they have 3, this move can be Burst 2.

Katana.Name: Rising Sun
Katana.Effect: The user gains a Shield equal to X% of this attack's damage, where X is five times the amount of Enrage counters the user has.

Katana.Name: Delirium Slash
Katana.Effect: This attack has doubled bonus dice from Fallen Blade, and the user takes recoil equal to the damage dealt by the extra bonus dice. If the recoil would kill the user, they are left at 1 HP instead.

Katana.Name: Giant Slayer
Katana.Effect: If the target has at least 40 more HP than the user, Fallen Blade dice on this move are converted into bonus damage equal to ten times the number of Enrage counters the user has.

Rapier.Name: Point-in-Line
Rapier.Effect: This attack can be used even when sealed.

Rapier.Name: Counter
Rapier.Effect: This move may be used on a foe hitting the user in Melee range, after accuracy has been rolled. The foe's attack loses 3 damage (5 damage if the player used Feint on their last turn). This ability is immune to non-Rapier outside factors to damage and does not add ATK.

Rapier.Name: Thrust
Rapier.Effect: The user moves to a spot adjacent, but not diagonally, to the target. If the user cannot enter the target's Melee, they move as close to the target as possible. If the target was at full HP, they are inflicted with 5 Bleed/1.

Rapier.Name: Deflect
Rapier.Effect: This move may be used on a foe attacking the user from range, after accuracy has been rolled. The user gains 2 DR (4 DR if the user is under the effects of En Garde) for the duration of the attack this is used on. This ability is immune to non-Rapier outside factors to damage and does not add ATK.

Rapier.Name: Feint
Rapier.Effect: The user's next Reaction deals an additional 1d6+5 damage.

Rapier.Name: En Garde
Rapier.Effect: For one round, the user gains 5 DR, and their Reaction moves become MR 0.

Rapier.Name: Moulinet
Rapier.Effect: The user's Reaction abilities ignore evasions for one round.

Rapier.Name: Riposte
Rapier.Effect: This may be used on a foe in melee range that missed an attack on the user. This ability is immune to non-Rapier outside factors to damage and does not add ATK.

Rapier.Name: Patinando
Rapier.Effect: The user picks Fast or Slow. Fast: The user's next Reaction grants them +2 evasions until the end of the target's next turn. Slow: The user's next reaction gives them 10 DR for the duration of the attack it is used on.

Rapier.Name: Parry
Rapier.Effect: This move may be used when a foe targeting the user would deal 40+ damage before damage reducing effects on an attack that hits the user. This ability is immune to non-Rapier outside factors to damage and does not add ATK.
